title: Rational Function - Modeling Avg Rate of Change

content.description: The function <math alttext="C"><mi>C</mi></math> models the cost, in dollars, for producing <math alttext="x"> <mi>x</mi> </math> items and is given by <math alttext="C open parentheses x close parentheses equals fraction numerator 1000 plus b x over denominator x end fraction"><mi>C</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1000</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow><mi>x</mi></mfrac></math>, where <math alttext="b"><mi>b</mi></math> is a constant. It is known that the cost is <math alttext="$ 115"><mo>$</mo><mn>115</mn></math> to produce <math alttext="10"><mn>10</mn></math> items and <math alttext="$ 65"><mo>$</mo><mn>65</mn></math> to produce <math alttext="20"><mn>20</mn></math> items.
content.question: What is the average rate of change of <math alttext="C"><mi>C</mi></math> as <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> changes from <math alttext="x equals 30"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>30</mn></math> to <math alttext="x equals 40"> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>40</mn> </math> ?

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Apply numerical results in a given mathematical or applied context.
